channel.title: Music
channel.description: NPR Music features, streams, live concerts and music news.

item.title: First Watch: Lord Huron, 'Lonesome Dreams'
item.description: Think of Lord Huron as a complex imaginary world, with invented characters and interlocking stories, as much as a band that makes charming rock songs.
item.content:encoded:
Think of Lord Huron as a complex imaginary world, with invented characters and interlocking stories, as much as a band that makes charming rock songs.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Rolling Stones To Return To Hyde Park After 44 Years
item.description: The Rolling Stones confirmed this week that they will perform in London's Hyde Park in July, 44 years after their last appearance there. The 1969 concert drew a 250,000 people and was tinged with sorrow, coming just two days after the death of the band's guitarist and founding member Brian Jones. Just before performing, Mick Jagger silenced the crowd and, in memory of Jones, read a stanza from Percy Bysshe Shelley's poem on Keats's death, "Adonais." This was a time when drugs and alcohol were beginning to take a heavy toll on rock stars and the concert has been called a defining moment in rock and roll.
item.content:encoded:
The Rolling Stones confirmed this week that they will perform in London's Hyde Park in July, 44 years after their last appearance there. The 1969 concert drew a 250,000 people and was tinged with sorrow, coming just two days after the death of the band's guitarist and founding member Brian Jones. Just before performing, Mick Jagger silenced the crowd and, in memory of Jones, read a stanza from Percy Bysshe Shelley's poem on Keats's death, "Adonais." This was a time when drugs and alcohol were beginning to take a heavy toll on rock stars and the concert has been called a defining moment in rock and roll.

item.title: 'Kinky Boots' Walk Cyndi Lauper To Broadway
item.description: Kinky Boots, the quirky independent British film, has been turned into a splashy Broadway musical with a score by pop icon Cyndi Lauper. Reporter Jeff Lunden takes look.
item.content:encoded:
Kinky Boots, the quirky independent British film, has been turned into a splashy Broadway musical with a score by pop icon Cyndi Lauper. Reporter Jeff Lunden takes look.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Live At Carnegie Hall: Jonathan Biss And The Elias String Quartet
item.description: In an art form filled with tortured souls, Robert Schumann stands out — even more than 150 years after his death. Hear one of America's finest young pianists and an emerging English string quartet play music by the visionary composer, as well as music by Mozart and artists Schumann influenced.
item.content:encoded:
In an art form filled with tortured souls, Robert Schumann stands out — even more than 150 years after his death. Hear one of America's finest young pianists and an emerging English string quartet play music by the visionary composer, as well as music by Mozart and artists Schumann influenced.

item.title: Music Producer Phil Ramone Dies At 79
item.description: Ramone worked with top artists to create some of the most unforgettable music of our era. He had been hospitalized in February with an aortic aneurysm.
item.content:encoded:
Ramone worked with top artists to create some of the most unforgettable music of our era. He had been hospitalized in February with an aortic aneurysm.

item.title: John Lennon's Bloodied Glasses Used In Plea On Gun Violence
item.description: Yoko Ono, the widow of the Beatle slain in 1980, tweets the graphic photo on the 44th anniversary of the couple's marriage.
item.content:encoded:
Yoko Ono, the widow of the Beatle slain in 1980, tweets the graphic photo on the 44th anniversary of the couple's marriage.

item.title: The Ale That Men Brew: Iron Maiden Serves Up A Beer
item.description: Three decades after giving the world The Number of the Beast, Iron Maiden is poised to release its latest work — and it's a beer. "As a fan of traditional English cask beer, I thought this could actually be something really exciting," singer Bruce Dickinson says.
item.content:encoded:
Three decades after giving the world The Number of the Beast, Iron Maiden is poised to release its latest work — and it's a beer. "As a fan of traditional English cask beer, I thought this could actually be something really exciting," singer Bruce Dickinson says.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: VIDEO: Fan Accompanies Billy Joel; 'Greatest Moment Of My Life,' He Says
item.description: A bold question to the pop star — "could I play with you?" — got an "OK" response. The video of student Michael Pollack knocking it out of the park on the piano as Joel sings is going viral. "Guy's got chops!" Joel declared.
item.content:encoded:
A bold question to the pop star — "could I play with you?" — got an "OK" response. The video of student Michael Pollack knocking it out of the park on the piano as Joel sings is going viral. "Guy's got chops!" Joel declared.

item.title: Alvin Lee Is Going Home: 'Ten Years After' Guitarist Dies
item.description: His fiery performance at Woodstock is legendary. The band would go on to have a hit with "I'd Love to Change the World."
item.content:encoded:
His fiery performance at Woodstock is legendary. The band would go on to have a hit with "I'd Love to Change the World."

item.title: Justin Bieber Apologizes For Delay In Start Of London Concert
item.description: After a Monday concert at O2 Arena that reportedly started two hours late, the 19-year-old pop star apologized for upsetting disappointed young concertgoers and their angry parents.
item.content:encoded:
After a Monday concert at O2 Arena that reportedly started two hours late, the 19-year-old pop star apologized for upsetting disappointed young concertgoers and their angry parents.

item.title: Van Cliburn, Renowned American Concert Pianist, Dies
item.description: Cliburn achieved worldwide recognition when he won the first International Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscow as a 23-year-old. What's more, he did so in 1958, at the height of the Cold War.
item.content:encoded:
Cliburn achieved worldwide recognition when he won the first International Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscow as a 23-year-old. What's more, he did so in 1958, at the height of the Cold War.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Astronaut And Rocker Pen First Earth-Space Duet
item.description: Talk about the ultimate space jam. The song is called "I.S.S. (Is Somebody Singing)," and it's a very long-distance collaboration between Canadians Ed Robertson of Barenaked Ladies and Chris Hadfield, who currently commands the International Space Station. The song premiered Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Talk about the ultimate space jam. The song is called "I.S.S. (Is Somebody Singing)," and it's a very long-distance collaboration between Canadians Ed Robertson of Barenaked Ladies and Chris Hadfield, who currently commands the International Space Station. The song premiered Friday.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Reg Presley, Who Sang 'Wild Thing' With The Troggs, Dies
item.description: The 71-year-old singer died at his home in England. If you can play three chords, you can pay him some musical respect.
item.content:encoded:
The 71-year-old singer died at his home in England. If you can play three chords, you can pay him some musical respect.

item.title: Beyoncé On Lip-Syncing: 'I Did Not Feel Comfortable Taking A Risk'
item.description: Beyoncé finally put an end to all the talk surrounding her inaugural performance. And she did it in diva fashion.
item.content:encoded:
Beyoncé finally put an end to all the talk surrounding her inaugural performance. And she did it in diva fashion.

item.title: Patty Andrews, Leader Of The Andrews Sisters, Dies
item.description: Andrews was the youngest of the boogie-woogie sibling act, which played more USO tours during World War II than anyone besides Bob Hope. She was also known as the most charismatic of the trio.
item.content:encoded:
Andrews was the youngest of the boogie-woogie sibling act, which played more USO tours during World War II than anyone besides Bob Hope. She was also known as the most charismatic of the trio.
